column2: Kathy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Received a Sympathetic Nerve Block for CRS (complex regional syndrome). Burning from CRS is greatly reduced by the 3rd day following procedure. Highly recommend conscience sedation for procedure.

column2: diamonddog, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: it is being used in my pain pump

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column9: I have severe swelling af a finger joint due to trama.  I was given a steroid injection with Marcaine added to block pain.  Injection stung like crazy. I was not looking at the needle when injected and felt when the Dr pushed meds each time.  Immediately after injection my finger was numb and painless, however, an hour after the injection my finger hurt 10x worse than before.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I received my first injection today for horrible and very frequent migraines.  I had six shots in the neck muscles that run from my shoulder to my neck.  By the time the first three were injected, I could tell a difference.  By the time the second three were in, my migraine was GONE.  It was like a miracle.  Then I came home.  It has now been about an hour and a half since the shot and I can already feel the migraine coming back.  I hope it is coming back because all my triggers are present at this time (weather, horomones, stress) except the food triggers.  Even if it comes back full force, this was still a miracle drug/procedure for me.

column2: Zelda, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: My doctor injects my trigger points with Marcaine every three months as needed for firbromyalgia therapy. I find the injections to be very painful, even after he sprays a numbing agent over the areas. I haven't had great relief yet from treatment. So far, I have had at least six series of injections.

I had an injection in a hip for bursitis.  Marcaine and a steroid was used.  The hip pain went away but I had flushing of the face, slight temp, headache, elevated BP and couldn't sleep.  Could it have been a reaction due to Lisinopril for BP?  I didn't take the pill before having the injection but did the next day and felt worse. Could this have been the reason.Does Marcaine cause more problems in this respect then Xylocaine?

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Used through an onQ with infusion postsurgical.

column2: buttercup, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Had this injected into my hip for pain, seems to be working great. But only tempary pain relief so I was told.

column2: marcaine, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
artful, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had Marcaine injected into my knees for joint pain and had a severe blood pressure reaction to it (maybe an alergic reaction?) 3-4 hours after getting the injections, I found my blood pressures in the 210/105 range ... scarey!
